alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 10:41PM AKST until December 27 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of around two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...The eastern Gulf Coast, the central Inner Channels, the southeast Gulf Coast, portions of the northern Inner Channels, and portions of the southern Inner Channels including Juneau, Ketchikan, Sitka, Petersburg, Wrangell, Thorne Bay, Craig, Klawock, Hydaburg, Kake, Angoon, Gustavus, Hoonah, Tenakee Springs, Pelican, Elfin Cove, Port Alexander, Port Protection, Point Baker, Coffman Cove, Hollis, Metlakatla, Edna Bay, Naukati Bay, Whale Pass, and other nearby communities. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Smooth, bare surfaces especially, may obtain a light glaze that could be very treacherous for pedestrians and vehicles in Glacier Bay, Chichagof Island, Baranof Island, near Cross Sound, and southern Admiralty Island. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation slowly pushes into the southern Panhandle into early Monday morning. Precipitation likely ends for the northern Panhandle by 6 AM Monday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
